instructions.1: Combine the pork chops, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, vegetable oil, and garlic in a large resealable plastic bag. Squeeze as much excess air from bag as possible. Marinate in refrigerator 4 to 24 hours.
instructions.2: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
instructions.3: Remove the pork chops from the marinade directly to the grill. Discard the marinade.
instructions.4: Cook until the pork is no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

questions.question: Is as much excess air from Step 1 still available in Step 3?
Is worcestershire sauce live after Step 3?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 1?
